title: Get started
code: library(glitter) #>  #> Attaching package: 'glitter' #> The following object is masked from 'package:sequins': #>  #>     get_label query=spq_init() %>%   spq_add("?mayor wdt:P31 ?species") %>%   # dog, cat or chicken   spq_set(species = c('wd:Q144','wd:Q146', 'wd:Q780')) %>%   # who occupy the function   spq_add("?mayor p:P39 ?node") %>%   # of mayor   spq_add("?node ps:P39 wd:Q30185") %>%   # of some places   spq_add("?node pq:P642 ?place")   graph_query(query, layout="tree", flip=TRUE)

title: Get started
code: query=spq_init() %>%   spq_add("?doc dcterms:creator ?createur") %>%           spq_add("?createur hal:structure ?affil") %>%           spq_add("?createur hal:person ?personne") %>%           spq_add("?personne foaf:name 'Lise Vaudor'") %>%   spq_add("?affil skos:prefLabel ?affiliation") %>%       spq_add("?doc dcterms:type ?type") %>%            # récupère le type de document   spq_add("?type skos:prefLabel ?type_label") %>%   # étiquette le type de document         spq_filter(lang(type_label) == 'fr') %>%          # ... en français   spq_add("?doc dcterms:bibliographicCitation ?citation") %>% # récupère la citation   spq_add("?doc dcterms:issued ?date")   graph_query(query, layout="tree") graph_query(query, flip=TRUE, label=TRUE)

title: Get started
code: sequins::get_label("wd:Q152088",language="en") #> [1] "french fries" sequins::get_label("'David Bowie'") #> [1] "'David Bowie'" sequins::get_label('"John Doe"') #> [1] "\"John Doe\"" sequins::get_label("?item") #> [1] "?item"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vaudor L (2023). sequins: Show Glitter Queries (SPARQL Queries Written R Code) Graphs. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://lvaudor.github.io/sequins/.

what: Show Glitter Queries (SPARQL Queries Written As R Code) As Graphs
title: Show Glitter Queries (SPARQL Queries Written As R Code) As Graphs
text: goal {sequins} provide way plot graphs depicting {glitter} queries. Learn {glitter} use collect data SPARQL endpoints .

title: Show Glitter Queries (SPARQL Queries Written As R Code) As Graphs
text: can install development version sequins GitHub :

title: Show Glitter Queries (SPARQL Queries Written As R Code) As Graphs
text: basic example use function sequins::graph_query() show glitter query graph:
code: library(glitter) library(sequins) ##  ## Attachement du package : 'sequins'  ## L'objet suivant est masqué depuis 'package:glitter': ##  ##     get_label query=spq_init() %>%   spq_add("?mayor wdt:P31 ?species") %>%   spq_set(species = c('wd:Q144','wd:Q146', 'wd:Q780')) %>%   spq_add("?mayor p:P39 ?node") %>%   spq_add("?node ps:P39 wd:Q30185") %>%   spq_add("?node pq:P642 ?place")   graph_query(query, layout="tree", label=TRUE)

title: Title — get_label
text: string string (part triple pattern) label language language return label (defaults "en") endpoint SPARQL endpoint queried (defaults "Wikidata") labelling_prop name labelling property, instance "skos:prefLabel". Defaults "rdfs:label" function takes component triple pattern input returns (exists) corresponding human-readable label.

title: Title — get_label
code: sequins::get_label("wd:Q152088",language="en") #> Error in spq_perform(., endpoint = endpoint): could not find function "spq_perform" sequins::get_label("'David Bowie'") #> [1] "'David Bowie'" sequins::get_label('"John Doe"') #> [1] "\"John Doe\"" sequins::get_label("?item") #> [1] "?item"

what: A plot of the query depicted as a graph — graph_query
title: A plot of the query depicted as a graph — graph_query
A plot of the query depicted as a graph — graph_query
code: graph_query(query, layout = "fr", flip = FALSE, label = FALSE)

title: A plot of the query depicted as a graph — graph_query
text: query query returned glitter (call spq_perform) layout type layout. Can e.g. "tree" flip whether flip coordinates. Defaults FALSE label whether label identifiers graph

title: A plot of the query depicted as a graph — graph_query
A plot of the query depicted as a graph — graph_query
code: library(glitter) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘glitter’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:sequins’: #>  #>     get_label query=spq_init() %>%   spq_add("?mayor wdt:P31 ?species") %>%   # dog, cat or chicken   spq_set(species = c('wd:Q144','wd:Q146', 'wd:Q780')) %>%   # who occupy the function   spq_add("?mayor p:P39 ?node") %>%   # of mayor   spq_add("?node ps:P39 wd:Q30185") %>%   # of some places   spq_add("?node pq:P642 ?place")   graph_query(query, layout="tree", flip=TRUE)

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.
